Description: The Minor in Product Management, offered through the Undergraduate Tepper School of Business, provides students with a foundation in marketing, strategic planning, and hands-on product development. Core coursework includes Marketing I; Strategy for High-Tech Products and Services; Introduction to Product Management; and Principles of Microeconomics (or the accelerated version). To foster creative problem-solving and human-centered innovation, students select one Design Thinking course—Design Thinking for Business: Creative Solutions for Complex Problems; Designing Human-Centered Software; or User-Centered Research and Evaluation. An additional marketing elective—Consumer Behavior; Marketing Research; Pricing Strategy; or Advertising and Marketing Communications—deepens understanding of market dynamics and consumer insights. If a student successfully passes the 73-102 Microeconomics waiver exam, the economics requirement is waived and the student must complete an extra 9 units of minor coursework. This minor equips future product managers to lead cross-functional teams, drive user-centered innovation, and launch products that succeed in competitive markets.
Required Courses: 70-381 Marketing I and 70-387 Strategy for High-Tech Products and Services and 70-452 Introduction to Product Management and (73-102 Principles of Microeconomics or 73-104 Principles of Microeconomics Accelerated)
Design Thinking Requirement: 70-389 Design Thinking for Business: Creative Solutions for Complex Problems or 05-391 Designing Human Centered Software or 05-410 User-Centered Research and Evaluation
Marketing Course: 70-385 Consumer Behavior or 70-481 Marketing Research or 70-482 Pricing Strategy or 70-483 Advertising and Marketing Communications
Transfer Credit: While there are no double counting restrictions between the minor and the student's home college general education requirements, only one minor course may double-count with any other major or minor requirements.
Notes: If a student successfully passes the 73-102 waiver, this requirement is waived and the student must take an additional 9 units of minor coursework.
